sen.j: のしいか（伸し烏賊、熨斗烏賊）とはイカを乾燥させた食べ物。
sen.e: Noshiika (伸し烏賊 or 熨斗烏賊 in Chinese characters) is a kind of food made of dried cuttlefish.
sen.cmt: あとの訳にも影響するので漢字表記をそのまま組み入れました。
sen.e: Noshiika (伸し烏賊 or 熨斗烏賊) is a food made from dried squid.
Noshiika (伸し烏賊 or 熨斗烏賊) is a food made from dried squid.

sen.j: 酒のつまみとして出される事も多い。
sen.e: It is often served as a snack for drinks.
It is often served as a snack with alcohol.
It is often served as a snack with alcohol.

sen.j: 延ばして厚さがとても薄い事からこの名前が付いたと思われる説がある。
sen.e: Some say that its name originates in how it is made, i.e. being stretched flat and very thin (伸し or 'noshi', a word deriving from a verb 'nosu' which means 'to roll something flat').
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、および伸しに関する説明を付与しました。
sen.e: Some say that its name originates from how it is made, i.e. being stretched out very thinly (伸し, which is pronounced 'noshi', is a Japanese word derived from the verb 'nosu', which means to roll something flat).

Some say that its name originates from how it is made, i.e. being stretched out very thinly (伸し, which is pronounced 'noshi', is a Japanese word derived from the verb 'nosu', which means to roll something flat).

sen.j: しかし、熨斗烏賊とも書くことから熨斗から名前がついたという説もある。
sen.e: As it is written as 熨斗烏賊 as well, however, others say the name comes from the resemblance of its shape to 熨斗 or 'noshi' (a thin strip of dried abalone wrapped in folded red and white paper).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、および熨斗に関する説明を付与しました。
sen.e: As it can also be written as 熨斗烏賊, however, others say the name comes from its resemblance to 熨斗 (pronounced 'noshi', this Japanese word is used to describe a thin strip of dried abalone wrapped in folded red and white paper).

As it can also be written as 熨斗烏賊, however, others say the name comes from its resemblance to 熨斗 (pronounced 'noshi', this Japanese word is used to describe a thin strip of dried abalone wrapped in folded red and white paper).

sen.j: スルメとほぼ同義の言葉としても使われているが、現述のものは加工されて切断されていないもののみを指す。
sen.e: Being also used as almost a synonym for surume or dried cuttlefish, noshiika only refers to one which has not gone through the shredding-process.
Given that it is also used as a virtual synonym for surume (dried cuttlefish), noshiika only refers to squid that has not undergone the shredding-process.
Given that it is also used as a virtual synonym for surume (dried cuttlefish), noshiika only refers to squid that has not undergone the shredding-process.

sen.j: 屋台の実演販売では、熱して柔らかくした干したイカを鉄製のローラーにくぐらせて薄く弾きのばしている。
sen.e: In demonstration sales at a street stall, dried cuttlefish are heated until they become soft, and they are rolled out thin through between a pair of steel rollers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: In demonstration sales at a street stalls, dried squid are heated until they become soft, and they are rolled out thinly between a pair of steel rollers.
In demonstration sales at a street stalls, dried squid are heated until they become soft, and they are rolled out thinly between a pair of steel rollers.

sen.j: そして、一枚の干しイカから驚くほどの長さののしいかが生産される。
sen.e: And an amazingly lengthy noshiika is produced this way from a single piece of dried cuttlefish.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処置
sen.e: This method produces an amazingly long piece of noshiika from a single piece of dried squid.
sen.cmt: Reworded to read naturally and for consistency.
sen.e: This method produces an amazingly long piece of noshiika from a single piece of dried squid.

sen.j: なお駄菓子として発売されている「のしいか」と名付けられた商品は、タラなどの白身魚を擦り身にして薄く延ばしたものを使用していることが多い。
sen.e: Additionally, a kind of cheap sweets sold under the name of 'noshiika' is often made from the ground and thinly rolled out meat of whitefish such as cod.
Additionally, a variety of cheap confectionary sold under the name 'noshiika' is often made from the ground and thinly rolled out meat of whitefish such as cod.
Additionally, a variety of cheap confectionary sold under the name 'noshiika' is often made from the ground and thinly rolled out meat of whitefish such as cod.

sen.j: 珍味として販売されている「のしいか」には単に乾燥させたイカではなく、甘く味付けされたものもある。
sen.e: Noshiika' sold as a kind of delicacies includes one which is not simply dried but further seasoned sweet.
Noshiika' sold as a delicacy include a variety which is not only dried but further seasoned sweet.
Noshiika' sold as a delicacy include a variety which is not only dried but further seasoned sweet.

sen.j: こちらの原材料はまぎれもなくイカであり、北海道の名産品として売られていることが多いが、実際には各地で生産されているようである。
sen.e: This type of 'noshiika' is genuinely made from cuttlefish and is often sold as a Hokkaido specialty, but the reality appears that it is produced in various parts of Japan.
This type of 'noshiika' is unquestionably made from squid and is often sold as a Hokkaido specialty, but in reality appears to be produced in various parts of Japan.
This type of 'noshiika' is unquestionably made from squid and is often sold as a Hokkaido specialty, but in reality appears to be produced in various parts of Japan.
